articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China and the United States exchanged accusations at the weekend over the disputed South China Sea, after China's military said it had driven away a U.S. warship that the U.S. Navy said was on a routine freedom of navigation operation.
articles.title: China, US exchange accusations over US vessel in South China Sea

articles.author: Toby Sterling
articles.description: Veteran Dutch anti-Islam politician Geert Wilders on Saturday vowed to be prime minister of the Netherlands eventually, following an election in which his party won the most seats.
articles.title: Dutch politician Wilders vows 'I will be prime minister' on X

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Pope Francis will recite his weekly Angelus prayer on Sunday from the chapel of his Vatican residence instead of the usual venue overlooking St. Peter's Square, the Vatican said in a statement.
articles.title: Ailing pope to recite Sunday prayer from residence, not St. Peter's square

articles.author: Hyonhee Shin
articles.description: The foreign ministers of China, Japan and South Korea met in the port city of Busan on Sunday, seeking to restart co-operation among the Asian neighbours and pave the way for a summit of their three leaders.
articles.title: Top diplomats of China, Japan, S.Korea seek to boost three-way ties

articles.author: Saurabh Sharma
articles.description: Efforts to rescue 41 workers trapped in a highway tunnel in the Indian Himalayas for two weeks will be further slowed as rescuers are considering drilling through the last 10 meters of debris manually, an official said on Saturday.
articles.title: Manual drilling likely in last stretch to rescue 41 trapped workers in Indian tunnel

articles.author: Troy Merida, Raquel Cunha
articles.description: One month since Hurricane Otis devastated Acapulco, fears for the local economy stalk the Mexican beach resort with businesses saying efforts to repair the damage have been too slow to save a vital part of the tourist season: December.
articles.title: Slow Acapulco recovery after hurricane fans fears over livelihoods

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Two of three journalists recently kidnapped in southern Mexico have been freed unharmed, the journalists' international free-speech group Article 19 said in a statement on Saturday.
articles.title: Kidnappers free two journalists in Mexico, press group says

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Maayan Lubell
articles.description: Thirteen Israeli and four Thai nationals released from Hamas captivity arrived in Israel on Sunday and were set to be reunited with their families as part of a crucial hostage deal, which briefly risked falling apart due to a dispute over aid supplies.
articles.title: Hamas releases Israeli, Thai hostages under temporary truce

articles.author: Max Hunder
articles.description: Ukraine needs more air defences to protect its grain export routes as well regions bordering Russia, President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said on Saturday, as he addressed an international summit on food security in Kyiv.
articles.title: Ukraine needs more air defences to protect grain exports, Zelenskiy says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's health ministry on Sunday urged local authorities to increase the number of fever clinics as the country grapples with a surge in respiratory illnesses in its first full winter since easing COVID-19 restrictions.
articles.title: China ministry seeks more fever clinics to combat respiratory illness surge
